document.title: SP659 Cabling, Bracing and Other Support Systems for Trees

author.organization: The University of Tennessee Agricultural Extension Service

document.abstract: Urban trees often need some degree of supplemental, physical support to reduce the risk of structural failure of the crown or root system. Cabling, bracing, guying and staking can provide a solution for these tree failures. Tree-support systems help support the tree by limiting the movement of branches, leaders or the entire tree. They can reduce the risk of injury to humans and damage to property by providing supplemental support for structurally weak areas of the tree.
